repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: The usage of `_BitScanForward64` causes linking to fail on some systems.

Solution: Correctly check if it exists using `check_c_source_compiles`.

Fix #28122

comment_data.body: Shouldn't there also be a change to `cmake.config/config.h.in`?
And I think this should be placed near other `check_c_source_compiles` checks instead of being at the end of the file.
Oh gosh how did I miss that

comment_regular_data.body:
We could use `check_c_source_compiles` and use that to conditionally decide?
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/cmake.config/CMakeLists.txt#L9

Was https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27969 for performance reasons or just nice to have?

> We could use `check_c_source_compiles` and use that to conditionally decide?
> 
> https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/cmake.config/CMakeLists.txt#L9
> 
> Was #27969 for performance reasons or just nice to have?

Primarily for consistency and performance reasons.

Good point on using `check_c_source_compiles`. Gonna do that now.

Wait, isn't ` _BitScanForward64` always available on 64-bit windows or was that an incorrect assumption? `check_c_source_compiles` is not as free as you'd think, each one of these checks adds to the configure time.
It's not a blocker for this PR, but still something that should be fixed in the future IMO.
does `check_c_source_compiles` check if things can _link_ ? because that was the failing step.

> does `check_c_source_compiles` check if things can _link_ ? because that was the failing step.

Checked the docs, they claim that linking is also checked.

> Wait, isn't ` _BitScanForward64` always available on 64-bit windows or was that an incorrect assumption?

@dundargoc  I thought so too but explicitly checking if `_WIN64` was defined did not prevent the link failure for me either, I also double-checked that I installed the x64 compiler
Hmm, weird. OK, I guess this is needed then until we know more

title: build: fix link error for `_BitScanForward64`
